config.name: Era Initialization
config.description: Creates era entities at simulation start. Establishes the timeline structure with supersedes relationships between consecutive eras.

config.name: Era Progression
config.description: Handles transitions between eras based on world state and per-era exitConditions. Updates era status from future → current → historical.

config.name: Agent Actions
config.description: Enables agents (NPCs, factions) to perform domain-defined actions. Manages action selection, success/failure, and influence tracking.

config.name: Relationship Maintenance
config.description: Handles decay, reinforcement, and culling of relationships. Maintains relationship health over time.

config.name: Conflict Spread
config.description: Spreads conflicts through alliance networks - allies of enemies become enemies

config.name: Alliance Formation
config.description: Factions with shared enemies may form alliances

config.name: Prominence Evolution
config.description: Entities with many connections gain prominence; isolated entities fade

config.name: Reflected Glory
config.description: Entities connected to high-prominence entities gradually gain prominence themselves. A sword wielded by a legendary hero becomes legendary; an NPC serving a mythic faction gains notoriety.

config.name: War Casualties
config.description: NPCs serving factions at war can fall in battle, their artifacts looted or lost

config.name: Heroic Sacrifice
config.description: Heroes caught in wars occasionally fall, their weapons becoming legendary

config.name: Old Age Mortality
config.description: Aging NPCs occasionally pass away, their artifacts inherited or lost

config.name: War Fatigue
config.description: Long-running wars become weary and ready to resolve

config.name: Occurrence Resolution
config.description: Active events settle into history over time

config.name: Post-War Recovery
config.description: Factions without active wars shed conflict tags

config.name: War Tie Cleanup
config.description: Archives stale war ties when no active war occurrence remains

config.name: Leadership Crisis
config.description: Detects factions with historical (deceased) leaders and marks them in crisis

config.name: Magic School Formation
config.description: Clusters magic abilities into unified schools. Only top practitioners by prominence become 'masters' with direct links to the meta-ability.

metaEntity.descriptionTemplate: A unified tradition encompassing {names}. Formed from {count} related abilities practiced by multiple penguins.

config.name: Combat Technique Formation
config.description: Clusters combat abilities into unified fighting styles. Only top practitioners by prominence become 'masters' with direct links to the meta-ability.

metaEntity.descriptionTemplate: A unified combat tradition encompassing {names}. Mastered by warriors who practice {count} techniques in harmony.

config.name: Legal Code Formation
config.description: Clusters rules into unified legal codes with governance factions

metaEntity.descriptionTemplate: A unified legal system encompassing {names}. Codified from {count} related rules.

config.name: Ideological Spread
config.description: Models ideological spread through social networks using SIR epidemic model

phaseTransitions.descriptionSuffix: This belief has spread widely and is now established tradition.

config.name: Cultural Evolution
config.description: Connected colonies become more similar (trade, friendly), isolated colonies diverge (secretive, hidden)

config.name: Thermal Diffusion
config.description: Heat spreads from anomaly sources, making locations dangerous or safe

config.name: Resource & Trade Flow
config.description: Prosperity spreads from resource-rich and trade locations

config.name: Trade Network Growth
config.description: Trade-connected factions controlling thriving colonies gain influence

config.name: Ability Fade
config.description: Abilities without practitioners gradually lose prominence

config.name: Artifact Degradation
config.description: Over time, artifacts may become damaged

config.name: Artifact Destruction
config.description: Damaged artifacts may be destroyed over time

config.name: Artifact Corruption
config.description: Cursed or corrupted artifacts affect their owners

config.name: Armed Hero Detection
config.description: Heroes who own weapons are tagged as armed, enabling them to hunt orcas

config.name: Devout Believer Detection
config.description: Factions with strong belief relationships are marked as devout

config.name: Heresy War
config.description: Devout factions are more likely to declare war on factions with apostate or different beliefs

config.name: Control Collapse
config.description: When a faction's control over a location weakens below threshold, they lose control entirely

config.name: Alliance Defense Call
config.description: When an allied faction is at war, allies consider joining the fight to honor their pact

config.name: Oath Breaker Detection
config.description: Allied factions that don't join wars are marked as oath breakers and lose reputation

config.name: Oath Breaker Consequences
config.description: Oath breakers suffer ongoing reputation damage and weakened alliances

config.name: Corruption Harm
config.description: NPCs residing in corrupted locations are harmed by the corruption - first corrupted, then killed

config.name: Unarmed Hero Detection
config.description: Heroes who lose their weapons are no longer armed

config.name: Corruption Crisis
config.description: Severely corrupted locations trigger a crisis that kills inhabitants and spreads fear

config.name: The Ice Remembers
config.description: The ice witnesses deeds at significant locations, annotating those present with echoes
